snippet: Both sides are likely to marshal arguments designed to sway the jury on a simple question: Did the defendant, Pedro Hernandez, tell the truth when he confessed to strangling the boy?
abstract: News Analysis; lawyers preparing for closing arguments in murder trial of Pedro Hernandez are likely to focus on whether he was truthful when he confessed to killing 6-year-old Etan Patz; defense will have to convince jury that Hernandez was mentally unstable such to offer repeated false confessions, while prosecution will have to overcome evidence pointing to second possible culprit, Jose A Ramos.
lead_paragraph: Both sides are likely to marshal arguments designed to sway the jury on a simple question: Did the defendant, Pedro Hernandez, tell the truth when he confessed to strangling the boy?

headline.print_headline: In Patz Trial, Closing Arguments Are Expected to Focus on Confession
headline.main: In Etan Patz Trial, Closing Arguments Are Expected to Focus on Confession
